pepper.framework.infra.resource.api module¶

class pepper.framework.infra.resource.api.Lock[source]¶

Bases: object

Example usage:

lock = resource_manager.get_lock("resource-identifier")
with lock:  # blocks waiting for lock acquisition
    # do something with the lock

Note: This lock is not re-entrant. Repeated calls after already acquired will block. This is an exclusive lock. For a read/write lock, see WriteLock and ReadLock.

acquire(blocking=True, timeout=None)[source]¶

Acquire the lock. By defaults blocks and waits forever.

Parameters

  • blocking (bool) – Block until lock is obtained or return immediately

  • timeout (float or None) – Wait at most the specified timeout in seconds to acquire the lock if the specified timeout is positive, otherwise wait indefinitely.

Returns

Signal if the lock was acquired

Return type

bool

Raises

LockTimeoutError – if the lock wasn’t acquired within timeout seconds.

property interrupted¶

Signals that the lock should be released by the current owner.

Returns

Whether the lock should be released by the current owner.

Return type

bool

property locked¶

Check if the lock is held by someone.

Returns

Signal if the lock is held by someone.

Return type

bool

release()[source]¶

Release the lock.

exception pepper.framework.infra.resource.api.LockTimeoutError[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Raised if an operation runs into a timeout constraint.

class pepper.framework.infra.resource.api.ReadLock[source]¶

Bases: pepper.framework.infra.resource.api.Lock

Read Lock Example usage:

lock = resource_manager.get_read_lock("resource-identifier")
with lock:  # blocks waiting for outstanding writers
    # do something with the lock

The read lock blocks if the resource is held by any writers, but multiple readers may hold the lock. Note: This lock is not re-entrant. Repeated calls after already acquired will block. This is the read-side of a shared lock. See Lock for a standard exclusive lock and WriteLock for the write-side of a shared lock.

interrupt_writers(interrupt=True)[source]¶

Set the interrupted flag on the lock to signal the current owner that the lock should be released.

class pepper.framework.infra.resource.api.ResourceContainer[source]¶

Bases: pepper.framework.infra.di_container.DIContainer

DIContainer providing a ResourceManager instance.

property resource_manager¶
class pepper.framework.infra.resource.api.ResourceManager[source]¶

Bases: object

ResourceManager manages resources available in the system.

Resources can be registered by name and different Locks can be obtained to synchronize access to the registered resources.

get_lock(name, blocking=True, timeout=-1)[source]¶

Obtain a Lock for the given resource.

Parameters

  • blocking (bool) – Block until the resource is available or return immediately

  • timeout (float or None) – Wait at most the specified timeout in seconds until the resource is available if the specified timeout is positive, otherwise wait indefinitely.

Returns

The lock.

Return type

Lock

get_read_lock(name, blocking=True, timeout=-1)[source]¶

Obtain a ReadLock for the given resource.

Parameters

  • blocking (bool) – Block until the resource is available or return immediately

  • timeout (float or None) – Wait at most the specified timeout in seconds until the resource is available if the specified timeout is positive, otherwise wait indefinitely.

Returns

The lock.

Return type

Lock

get_write_lock(name, blocking=True, timeout=-1)[source]¶

Obtain a WriteLock for the given resource.

Parameters

  • blocking (bool) – Block until the resource is available or return immediately

  • timeout (float or None) – Wait at most the specified timeout in seconds until the resource is available if the specified timeout is positive, otherwise wait indefinitely.

Returns

The lock.

Return type

Lock

has_resource(name)[source]¶

Check if a resource with the given name is registered in the ResourceManager.

Parameters

name (str) – The name of the resource.

Returns

Whether a resource with the given name is registered or not.

Return type

bool

provide_resource(name)[source]¶

Register the resource with the given name.

Parameters

name (str) – The name of the resource.

Raises

ValueError – if there is already a resource registered with the given name.

property resources¶

Retrieve all currently registered resource names.

Returns

A collection of the registered resource names.

Return type

Iterable[(str)]

retract_resource(name, force=False, timeout=-1)[source]¶

Unregister the resource with the given name.

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the resource.

  • force (bool) – Immediately retract the resource or block until all users released the released the resource.

  • timeout (float or None) – Wait at most the specified timeout in seconds until the resource is released if the specified timeout is positive, otherwise wait indefinitely.

class pepper.framework.infra.resource.api.WriteLock[source]¶

Bases: pepper.framework.infra.resource.api.Lock

Write Lock Example usage:

lock = resource_manager.get_write_lock("resource-identifier")
with lock:  # blocks waiting for lock acquisition
    # do something with the lock

The write lock can not be acquired if the resource is held by any readers or writers. Note: This lock is not re-entrant. Repeated calls after already acquired will block. This is the write-side of a shared lock. See Lock for a standard exclusive lock and ReadLock for the read-side of a shared lock.

interrupt_readers(interrupt=True)[source]¶

Set the interrupted flag on the lock to signal the current owner that the lock should be released.

pepper.framework.infra.resource.api.acquire(lock, blocking=True, timeout=-1)[source]¶
A context manager to enable usage of timeout and blocking arguments

in with blocks.

Example usage:

lock = resource_manager.get_write_lock("resource-identifier")
with acquire(lock, blocking=True, timeout=10):  # blocks waiting for lock acquisition with timeout
    # do something with the lock
